conclusion: Objects are casting shadows A, B, C, and D on the ground.
Light source is initially positioned such that shadows are cast in their current positions.
Light source moves to the front right, away from the objects.
Shadows will shift in the opposite direction of the light source movement, moving towards the back left.
As the light source moves away, the angle of light rays decreases, resulting in shorter shadows.
Shadow A will move towards the back left and become shorter.
Shadow B will move towards the back left and become shorter.
Shadow C will shift towards the back left and decrease in length.
Shadow D will move towards the back left and become shorter.
All shadows (A, B, C, and D) will shift towards the back left and become shorter.
